SEARCH
Module melange.common
Package gbw.melange.common.mesh.formatting

Interface IMeshDataTable

public interface IMeshDataTable
IMeshDataTable (variable-type table), is a System memory representation of the vertex data for a given Mesh and is for utility-, and storage purposes only. It, in itself, assures 100% data retention on any operation, however, it is not hotpath safe. Also, it allows the underlying data to stay as simple as possible (float arrays), while presenting it in a more manageable way which can be dictated whenever data is retrieved. (Although always as Slices, see IFloatSlice and its many children)

Also also, it's NOT THREADSAFE. To reduce the amount of allocations, all retrievals are cached, and this cache is synchronized with any other modifications immediately to keep the memory footprint near-constant. So please keep an eye on any loose threads.

The general structure can be visualized as: 
                  | vert1    | vert2     | vert3     | ...
 Position (3comp) | .0,.0,.0 | .0, 1f,.0 | 1f, 1f,.0 | ...
 UV       (2comp) | .0,.0,   | 0., 1f,   | 1f, 1f,   | ...
         .
         .
         .
Author:
GustavBW

  • Method Details

    • getVertexAttributes

      Set<IVertAttr<? extends IFloatSlice>> getVertexAttributes()
      Get all vertex attributes currently present in the table.

    • dropAttribute

      <T extends IFloatSlice> List<T> dropAttribute(IVertAttr<T> attr)
      Delete an attribute from the table and risk the wrath of the GC. Any current data is extracted and returned in the specified format, however that is the only reference to the former data of the attribute at that point.
      Parameters:
      attr - Attribute to delete.
      Returns:
      Any current data in the specified format, or an empty list if no data existed.

    • getVertexCount

      int getVertexCount()

    • copyAttributeData

      float[] copyAttributeData(IVertAttr<?> attr)
      Copy the current data for some attribute and return it as an array. If no such attribute is present, the array will be empty. The copying is done through Arrays.copyOf(float[], int) which is Object.clone() in this instance -pretty fast, but not hotpath safe.

    • getIndicies

      int[] getIndicies()

    • add

      Error add(IMeshDataTable other)
      Add the data from another IMeshDataTable onto the end of this as an irreversible process. Indices will not be modified, however the underlying float buffers will be extended. This also updates all lists of retrieved slices currently cached.
      Will error if:
      • The table to be added does not contain all attributes of this table, or the other way around.
      Returns:
      Error.NONE or an error describing what went wrong.

    • addOrReplaceAttribute

      <T extends IFloatSlice> Error addOrReplaceAttribute(IVertAttr<T> attr, int startIndex, float[] data)
      Add a new attribute to the mesh and update existing slice representations. If this attribute already exists, replace the current data. Addition or replacement will happen in the vertex order known to the IMeshDataTable.
      • If an insufficient amount of values are provided, an error is returned.
      • If too much data is provided, the remainder is ignored.
      • If the startIndex is not 0, and no data is already available for the attribute, an error is returned.
      For a less stringent method see addOrReplaceAttribute(IVertAttr, int, float[], float)
      Parameters:
      attr - What attribute to alter the data of, or set new data for
      startIndex - Where to start IN TERMS OF VERTEX NUMBER which is dependent on the IVertAttr.compCount()
      data - The actual float values to insert.
      Returns:
      an Error if any, or Error.NONE

    • addOrReplaceAttribute

      <T extends IFloatSlice> Error addOrReplaceAttribute(IVertAttr<T> attr, int startIndex, float[] data, float fillValue)
      Add a new attribute to the mesh. If this attribute already exists, replace the current data. Addition or replacement will happen in the vertex order known to the IMeshDataTable.
      • If an insufficient amount of values is provided, the rest are set to the fill value.
      • If too much data is provided, the remainder is ignored.
      • If the startIndex is not 0, and no data is already available for the attribute, the prior indexes are filled with the fill value.
      For a more stringent method see addOrReplaceAttribute(IVertAttr, int, float[]).
      Parameters:
      attr - What attribute to alter the data of, or set new data for
      startIndex - Where to start IN TERMS OF VERTEX NUMBER which is dependent on the IVertAttr.compCount()
      data - The actual float values to insert.
      Returns:
      an Error if any, or Error.NONE

    • calculateFaces

      List<Face> calculateFaces()
      See calculateFaces(Map) but without the generated lookup table

    • calculateFaces

      List<Face> calculateFaces(Map<ISliceVec3,List<Face>> allFacesOfVert)
      Extract the triangles as Face based on the indicies of the original mesh
      Parameters:
      allFacesOfVert - fill this provided map to create a lookup table between a given vertex position (vector 3, x, y, z) and all faces this vertex is a part of

    • extract

      <T extends IFloatSlice> List<T> extract(IVertAttr<T> attr)
      Extract the data for a given vertex attribute from the table in the repressentation specified by the vertex attribute itself. If the key itself fails validation checks, or no data is present, an empty list is returned. Use checkExtraction(IVertAttr, int) or MultiTypeTableChecker.checkKey(IVertAttr) for further information.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Anything that is, or can be percieved as an instance of IFloatSlice or subtype of an implementation of, or ...
      Parameters:
      attr - The vertex attribute to extract data for.
      Returns:
      A list of IFloatSlice instances representing the extracted data. If the attribute is not found or the key fails validation checks, this list will be empty. Any extracted list of slices is, and will be, the only instances until further modification as to keep the memory footprint contained.

    • extractCopy

      <T extends IFloatSlice> List<T> extractCopy(IVertAttr<T> attr)
      Same as extract(IVertAttr) but deep-copies everything but the source float arrays. This is registered as an extraction, so it does go through the cache, but the retrieved list is completely new instances.

    • convertToMesh

      com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh convertToMesh()
      Reduce the current segmentation to a flat float array and create a mesh using this and all other information about vertex attribute ordering, their usages, etc.

    • checkExtraction

      Error checkExtraction(IVertAttr<?> key, int expectedOutputLength)
      Returns:
      Error.NONE if the extraction can progress without issue else a description of the issue

    • copy

      IMeshDataTable copy()
      Copy the current internal storage into a new IMeshDataTable. The interal cache is not copied.
